intro: Zerna benekenii var. minor, commonly known as the lesser zerna, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, delicate flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
